get.summary: Read existing Protocol Independent Multicast configurations
get.description:
Configure Protocol Independent Multicast.
In a network, IP multicast traffic transmitted for multimedia applications
is blocked at routed interface boundaries unless a multicast routing protocol
is running. Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) is a family of routing
protocols. It forms multicast trees to forward traffic from multicast sources
to the clients requesting for traffic.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaPim_PimRouterSchema.description:
Configure Protocol Independent Multicast.
In a network, IP multicast traffic transmitted for multimedia applications
is blocked at routed interface boundaries unless a multicast routing protocol
is running. Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) is a family of routing
protocols. It forms multicast trees to forward traffic from multicast sources
to the clients requesting for traffic.

router.description: The list of all the PIM Router instances

vrf-address-family.description: Key combination of vrf and address-family separated by ~

static-rps.description: Statically configured RPs for IPv4 network

static-rp-policy.description:
Configure ACL to filter the IPv4 group addresses for an RP Address.
This enables PIM router to filter PIM join/prune messages destined for a
specific RP and specific groups. The ACL specifies the group addresses
which are allowed or denied.

anycast-rp-source-directly-connected.description:
Allow same multicast source to be directly connected
to two or more Anycast RP routers on IPv4 network

candidate-rp.description:
Candidate RP Configuration for IPv4 network.
A candidate RP is configured to take part in the rendezvous point(RP) election in
PIM Sparse Mode(SM). To become an RP, a candidate RP will announce itself to the
bootstrap router (BSR) using unicast packets.

candidate-bsr.description:
Candidate Bootstrap Router Configuration for IPv4 network.
A candidate BSR is configured so that it is eligible to be elected as the
Bootstrap Router (BSR) in a PIM domain. This is the router that collects
information from all available RPs in the network and advertises it on the
PIM domain.

rpf-override.description: Overrides normal Reverse Path Forwarding lookup mechanism for IPv4 network

static-rps-v6.description: Statically configured RPs for IPv6 network

static-rp-policy-v6.description: ACL to filter the IPv6 group addresses for an RP Address

candidate-rp-v6.description: Candidate RP Configuration for IPv6 network

candidate-bsr-v6.description: Candidate Bootstrap Router Configuration for IPv6 network

rpf-override-v6.description: Overrides normal Reverse Path Forwarding lookup mechanism for IPv6 network

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

candidate-bsr.description:

A candidate BSR is configured so that it is eligible to be elected as the

rpf-override.description: Overrides normal Reverse Path Forwarding lookup mechanism for IPv4 network

static-rp-policy-v6.description: ACL to filter the IPv6 group addresses for an RP Address

candidate-bsr-v6.description: Candidate Bootstrap Router Configuration for IPv6 network

rpf-override-v6.description: Overrides normal Reverse Path Forwarding lookup mechanism for IPv6 network

ArubaPim_PimStaticMulticastNexthopConfig.description: Grouping for Static Multicast Nexthop Configurations

source-prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
source-prefix.description: Range of the Multicast Source Address

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

nexthop-address.description: IP address of the Nexthop device

interface-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

rp-address.description: IP address of the RP to be used for a group prefix

group-address-range.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
group-address-range.description: Multicast group addresses associated with Static RP

override-enable.description: Prefer Static-RP over dynamically learnt RP

ssm-enable.description: Enable PIM Source Specific Multicast feature

join-prune-interval.description: Set time between PIM Join/Prune messages in seconds

active-active.description: Enable PIM active-active feature on VSX pair

redistribute-static.description:
Redistribute Static Multicast Routes as Joins into the
domain.

register-message-limit.description:
Limit on the maximum number of register messages
sent per second for the multicast flow

mroute-limit.description:
Limit on the maximum number of multicast route
entries that can be programmed

sources-per-group.description: Total number of sources allowed for a group

state-refresh.description:
Periodic interval at which state refresh
datagrams are sent

bfd-all-interfaces-enable.description: Enables BFD on all PIM interfaces

register-policy.description: Ingress ACL to filter processing of PIM register messages

ssm-range-policy.description: ACL to indicate Source Specific Multicast range

rp-group-policies.description: The list of all the rp group policies for IPv4 network

or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

registration messages to RP
